intro: Speculantha aphylla, commonly known as the leafless morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its lack of leaves, with only tendrils and flowers. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often found climbing over vegetation. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
